page.title: 12Buxhall - Historic Buildings
page.content:
50% of dwellings (68) in the area predate 1914 and the majority of these date from the 17th century. 27 are large farmhouse type, of which 13 are on working farms. Despite the number of historic houses only 8 are listed as{Grade II buildings}and thus have some protection from changes which could affect their character. The list of historic buildings is now under revision and additions are expected.
Many other potentially interesting buildings have suffered as a result of {unsympathetic modernisation}eg reroofing with unsuitable tiles, extensions not in scale or character with the original buldings. There are 12 thatched houses in the area, a further 5 thatches have been replaced by tiles since 1950.
